How to Use Basketball Scoreboard

Complete guide to mastering the scoreboard in minutes

üöÄGetting Started

1

Open the Scoreboard

Navigate to the main page. The scoreboard is ready to use immediately - no account required.

2

Set Your Teams

Click the Settings (‚öôÔ∏è) button to customize team names and colors. The default is HOME vs AWAY.

3

Choose Your Rules

Select FIBA, NBA, NCAA, or 3x3 rules. This automatically sets quarter length, shot clock, and foul limits.

üèÄScoring Points

1

Using Buttons

Click +1, +2, or +3 buttons under each team to add points. Use -1 to correct mistakes.

2

Using Keyboard (Faster!)

Press 1, 2, 3 for home team points. Press 7, 8, 9 for away team points. Hold Shift + number to subtract.

‚è±Ô∏èManaging the Timer

1

Start/Stop

Click the green Start button or press Spacebar to toggle the game timer.

2

Shot Clock

Click 24 to reset shot clock fully, or 14 for offensive rebound reset. Keyboard: R (24s) or Shift+R (14s).

3

Period Changes

When time expires, click "Period ‚Üí" to advance to the next quarter. Fouls reset automatically.

üü°Tracking Fouls

1

Add Team Fouls

Click "Foul" under the team, or press F (home) / Shift+F (away) on keyboard.

2

Bonus Indicators

The foul dots fill up. Yellow "BONUS" appears when the team is in penalty. Watch for this to award free throws!

3

Player Fouls

Click "Player Stats" to track individual player fouls. Players with 5+ fouls are highlighted red.

‚è∏Ô∏èTimeouts & Possession

1

Call Timeout

Click "Timeout" button or press T (home) / Shift+T (away). Timer automatically pauses.

2

Track Possession

Click ‚óÑ‚ñ∫ under a team to show possession arrow, or press Q (home) / W (away) / P (toggle).

üîóShare & Sync

1

Start Hosting

Click the Share button, then "Start Hosting" to get a 6-digit game code. Share this code with others.

2

Share View-Only Link

Copy the View-Only Link and send it to spectators. They can watch the live score without affecting the game.

3

Join a Game

Enter the 6-digit game code to join as a viewer or assistant scorekeeper.

4

Stop Hosting

Click "Stop Hosting" when you want to end the sharing session and return to local-only mode.

üìäExport

1

Export as Image

Click Export and choose PNG or JPG to download a screenshot of the current game state.

2

Export PDF Report

Generate a comprehensive PDF report with full game statistics, player performance, and scoring timeline.

3

Export Game Data

Download the complete game data in JSON format for backup or analysis purposes.

4

Copy Statistics

One-click copy of text-formatted game statistics to paste into messages or documents.

‚ö°Advanced Features

1

Fullscreen Mode

Press Escape or click the fullscreen button. Perfect for projecting on a big screen.

2

Player Statistics

Click "Player Stats" to track points, assists, rebounds, steals, blocks, and turnovers per player.

3

OBS Streaming

Copy the OBS link to add a transparent scoreboard overlay to your live stream.

4

Offline Mode

The app works without internet! Install it as a PWA for the best experience.

‚å®Ô∏è Keyboard Shortcuts Reference

Scoring

1 / 2 / 3Home team +1/+2/+3
7 / 8 / 9Away team +1/+2/+3
Shift + 1 or 7Subtract 1 point

Timer

SpaceStart/Pause timer
RReset shot clock (24s)
Shift + RReset shot clock (14s)
NNext period

Game Control

F / Shift+FFoul (home/away)
T / Shift+TTimeout (home/away)
Q / W / PPossession (home/away/toggle)
Ctrl + ZUndo
EscapeToggle fullscreen

üí° Pro Tips

  • ‚úìPractice keyboard shortcuts before the game - they're much faster than clicking
  • ‚úìUse fullscreen mode to eliminate distractions
  • ‚úìSet up team names and colors before the game starts
  • ‚úìThe shot clock automatically pauses when game time hits zero
  • ‚úìInstall as PWA for faster loading and offline reliability
